content.description:
Are you looking for a roof problem at Haycock?! If so, then this is the line you'll want to check out. Interesting moves lead you out this cave. If you refrain from researching the beta, you'll have a fun time trying to decipher the odd yet fun moves that will lead you to higher ground! 

  Start in the back of the cave on a flake and work your way towards the prominent notch. Figure out how to get around the lip and up through the little chasm. Hit the final seam and revel in the fact that you just did some acrobatic moves to get there!

 The easiest way to get to this problem is by coming from the Caves. Once you hit the caves, go around the backside and scramble up along the talus. Under My Thumb is about 150 yards uphill. Its somewhat hard to spot.
content.protection: 2-3 pads. Not a bad landing and the roof section is somewhat close to the ground.

content.description: SDS under the base of the finger crack. Do a move to gain the crack and climb it to it's end where a mantle encounter awaits on cool holds and awesome rock.
content.location: In front of and very close to Philthy Prow.

content.description: Start on the starting holds of Amber. With the use of a foot out left, mantle the starting holds. Once your standing on top of the beginning of the Amber rail, head up and left to a large, left facing jug. Climb the slab to the top of the boulder.

This is a rather large area spread across the talus field between the Little Fluffy Clouds boulders and The Big Area. Its hard to give exact directions to this place because its rather spread out. While this area is home to a lot of lower quality talus in regards to the total number of problems here, this area is home to several great lines that are classics on the mountain.
